events.name: GDG Cloud Belgium - Kickoff : Big Data on Google Cloud
events.description:
A few week after the global kickoff we’re proud to present the incarnation of the Belgian chapter of

Google Developers Group Cloud

GDG Cloud Belgium will focus on the technology around the Google Cloud Platform. We will show off the technology but also present the use cases build onto the platform.

Kickoff

For our first meetup we’ll have a packed agenda and will focus on Big Data. We’ll start of with a customer use-case of how Vente-Exclusive, a belgian flash sale site, uses GCP to manage it’s big data.

We’ll also be presenting two of the coolest technologies on GCP for your data needs. BigQuery for your interactive data analytics and DataFlow for your data pipelines, be it streaming or batch.

Agenda

19:00: Welcome

19:15: Google Big Data in the cloud at Vente-Exclusive.com

19:45: BigQuery: Matthias Feys - Data Geek at Datatonic

20:15: DataFlow: Alex Van Boxel - Google Developer Expert Cloud

20:45: Drinks and socialising

Audience

If you’re interested in the Google Cloud Platform, are a beginner, an expert or just curious: You are all invited for this first kickoff and make it a memorable event.

Food and Drinks

Today's sponsor Google will provide with some food and drinks afterwards. But don’t expect a full diner, so grab a bite on the way to the event.

GDG Cloud Organisers,

Matthias, Koen, Alex, Louis, Nicolas and Robin

events.name: Kubernetes rollout at Philips Hue
events.description:
It took longer then expected to brew our next meetup, but like any good beer it takes a while to get it to perfection. Today we’ll be introducing one of the newest technologies that will revolutionise software development: Kubernetes, and orchestrator for microservices. Koen Maes, a certified trainer will be introducing Kubernetes and some of it’s newest features in 1.2

We’re also happy that Christiaan Hees from Q42 is joining us, he helped with the migration of the Philips Hue customer facing portal from App Engine to Google Container Engine (Google’s Kubernetes as a service in the cloud). He will explain why and how they migrated to Kubernetes, and we’re sure will have some war stories as well.

Agenda

19:00 - Welcome

19:15 - Introduction to Kubernetes 1.2 - Koen Maes certified trainer

20:00 - Kubernetes at Philips Hue - Christiaan Hees from Q42 (NL)

20:45 - Drinks and socialising

Audience

If you’re interested in the Google Cloud Platform, are a beginner, an expert or just curious: You are all invited to this meetup.

GDG Cloud Organisers,

Matthias, Koen, Alex, Louis, Nicolas and Robin

events.name: Cloud Machine Learning and TensorFlow
events.description:
We are happy to announce the 3rd GDG Cloud meetup. We’ll give an introduction to the suite of Machine Learning products that Google Cloud Platform offers! More info: https://cloud.google.com/products/machine-learning/

If you are interested to see how you can leverage the secret sauce of Googles products into your own applications, you should join us on september 29 at the Google Office in Brussels. We will discuss and demo their pre-trained models (Speech API, Vision API, NLP API), which allow you to use Machine Learning without you actually having to do Machine Learning. As well as the tools that allow you to build your own models (TensorFlow and Cloud ML).

If you already use one of these services, we still have some spots lefts for you to talk about your experiences, feel free to contact us!

Agenda

19:00  Welcome -- Edward Boute

19:15  Pre-trained models: Speech, Vision and NLP API (talk and demo) -- Alex Van Boxel

20:00  Custom models: how to build and deploy your own models using TensorFlow and Cloud ML (talk and demo) -- Matthias Feys

20:45  Drinks and socialising

Audience

If you’re interested in the Google Cloud Platform, are a beginner, an expert or just curious: You are all invited to this meetup.

Food and Drinks

Today's sponsor Datatonic will provide with some food and drinks afterwards. But don’t expect a full dinner, so grab a bite on the way to the event.

GDG Cloud Organisers,
Alex, Koen, Matthias and Robin

events.name: Kubernetes - Hands-on Lab (3 hours)
events.description:
On December 6th GDG Cloud will hold it's first Kubernetes hand-on workshop. The workshop was written by acclaimed Kelsey Hightower and you will learn how to:

• Provision a basic Kubernetes cluster from the ground up on Container Engine (GKE)

• Deploy and manage Docker containers using kubectl

Kubernetes is all about applications and in this section you will utilize the Kubernetes API to deploy, manage, and upgrade applications. In the workshop you will use an example application called "app" to complete the labs.

• Workshop Setup

• Containerizing your application

• Creating and managing pods

• Monitoring and health checks

• Managing application configurations and secrets

• Creating and managing services

• Creating and managing deployments

• Rolling out updates

If you heard a lot about Kubernetes but never had the chance to get your hands dirty, now is the time. Thanks to g-company Belgium ( http://g.company/ ) for hosting. They will also provide pizza and some drinks.

We'll start at exactly 19:00 (doors open 18:30) and don't forget your laptop.

events.name: New Year's Reception
events.description:
Just like last year, all Google technologies user groups from Belgium are getting together to start the new year on the right foot.

We are very happy to invite you to the New Year's reception which is going to be a very good occasion to meet people from other Google communities and learn a bit about IoT in the process.

Please follow this link to register: https://events-belgaug.appspot.com/5744125232021504. Registering on meetup will not be official, so make sure you register through the link.

Be aware that there are only 20 seats available, so register fast :)

Agenda:

17.00: Opening doors - welcome drink

17.30: Welcome word by the heads of the usergroups

17.40: Google Speaker on IoT

18.10: Use case Translucid

18.40: Google Cardboard  (to be confirmed)

[masked]: Food & Drinks (catering by Syrian refugee women - 'From Syria with Love’) 

Hope to see you there.

events.name: Firebase Full Day Training
events.description:
We're honored to have Stefan Hogendoorn from Qlouder over to give a full day training in Firebase. Stefan is a Google Developer Expert for Firebase (and Google Cloud Platform) from the Netherlands. Although Firebase is very front facing, we will focus on the Cloud side of Firebase in this training. 

10:00 - 10:30 Reception 
10:30 - 11:15 Firebase Basics and use cases
11:15 - 12:30 Firebase data model, queries and best practices
12:30 - 13:30 Lunch
13:30 - 14:30 Firebase security rules and how (not) to use them  
14:30 - 15:30 Firebase analytics and growing your userbase
15:30 - 15:45 Break
15:45 - 16:30 What's new in Firebase?
16:30 - 17:00 Wrap up

Thanks to Edward for getting this organised! Don't know what Firebase is? Head over to https://firebase.google.com/ and have a look.

events.name: TensorFlow Dev Summit Viewing Party
events.description:
Join GDG Cloud Belgium to celebrate the very first TensorFlow dev summit! We'll join the TensorFlow team and machine learning experts from around the world for the keynote of this day full of technical talks, demos, and conversations in a live stream. Afterwards there will be room to discuss the latest announcements, ask questions and share your own experiences with TensorFlow.
Jeff Dean, Rajat Monga and Megan Kacholia will speak at the keynote.

Agenda
18:00 Door opens
18:30 The Keynote starts
20:00 Lightning talks & Drinks
20:30 Wrap up

Audience
Fit for anyone interested in Data Science, Machine Learning, Big Data at Scale and Google technology in general.

Foody stuff
We’ll have snacks and drinks sponsored by Datatonic (but not a full dinner so we recommend you grab a bite to eat on the way just in case).

More info
TensorFlow Dev Summit is an event organized by Google, for more information or to watch the remaining sessions, use this link.

events.name: The cloud is here to stay
events.description:
Dear Google enthusiast

We would like to invite you to ‘The cloud is here to stay’, a common event organised by Belgaug and GDG Cloud Belgium, sponsored by Translucid.

The Cloud has been omnipresent since a few years now, and it’s not going anywhere soon. Data center services that offer IAAS/PAAS and Machine learning based cloud API’s just create so much business value when used properly. We will be talking about GDPR and Google Cloud, followed by 3 interesting use-cases.

Agenda:

18.30 Opening doors - Welcome drinks

19.00 Welcome

19.10 The Public Cloud as an enabler for GDPR  - Julien Blanchez (Google)

19.50 Google Cloud and Hotel Room Booking - David De Winter (OTA insights)

20.30 Use-case 2: Vision API (Bazookas) - more info will follow

21.00 Use-case 3: Translate API (Untranslate) - more info will follow

21.30 Networking & Drinks

For more info and RSVP: https://events-belgaug.appspot.com/belgaug/5752142325350400﻿

events.name: Machine Learning at scale with GCP using ML Engine & Python Dataflow
events.description:
Doing Machine Learning typically involves big datasets and lots of model iterations. During this talk Matthias will show how to use GCP to speed up that process with ML Engine to train Tensorflow models and Dataflow to preprocess data.

19:00 Google Cloud Release Notes - by Alex Van Boxel

19:20 Cloud ML - by Matthias Feys

• Dissecting a Machine Learning Project

• Mapping the components to GCP tools

• Building a boilerplate example

20:40 Some drinks provided - by Google

22:00 End (offices close)

Speaker: Matthias Feys

events.name: Scheduling workloads with Apache Airflow and running Spark on Google Cloud
events.description:
We have two slightly related big data topics for you today.

Apache Airflow on GCP

Google Cloud has a lot of great Big Data services, but what if you need to orchestrate all these services. Are you tired of maintaining cron jobs with lots of un-reliable batch scripts? Well we have a great alternative: Apache Airflow !

Since 1.8 Airflow has a lot of Google Cloud service support (Cloud Storage, Dataproc, Dataflow, BigQuery, ...). We'll go over some scenario's on why and where you would use Airflow and highlight the Google support.

You can start following his series on Airflow on medium. 

Spreaker: Alex Van Boxel (Google Developer Expert at night, Software Architect @ Vente-Exclusive.com in the day). Alex is also a commiter to the Apache Airflow project.


Running Apache Spark as a service on Cloud Dataproc

Running Spark on Google Cloud is easy with with Dataproc. It's a managed Hadoop and Spark solution. It spins up in just over a minute, that you start thinking differently about your jobs. Maybe have a dedicated cluster for a certain job and destroy afterwards?

We'll also highlight it's integration in Airflow.

Speaker: Bob De Schutter (Data Scientist at Vente-Exclusive.com)

Thanks for OTA Insight for providing the location drinks and sandwiches. Our first meetup in Gent!

events.name: Istio, what is a service mesh (on Kubernetes) & Microservices @ Blendle
events.description:
Summer vacation is over and what does that mean?!  That Meetup season has started. We'll bring a technical season opener, with Istio:

Ist.io, what is a service mesh?

Istio is an open platform that provides a uniform way to connect, manage, and secure microservices. Istio supports managing traffic flows between microservices, enforcing access policies, and aggregating telemetry data, all without requiring changes to the microservice code.

You will get an overview of what Istio is and why you would use it.

Speaker: Alex Van Boxel (Google Developer Expert)

Resilient Microservices with Containers, Kubernetes and Google Cloud
Creating a single microservice is a well understood problem. Creating a cluster of load-balanced microservices that are resilient and self-healing is not so easy. Managing that cluster with rollouts and rollbacks, scaling individual services on demand, securely sharing secrets and configuration among services is even harder. Kubernetes, an open-source container management system, can help with this. In this talk, we will hear from Blendle who has made this journey from Monolith to Microservices, and will learn what makes Kubernetes a great system for automating deployment, operations, and scaling of containerized applications.

Speaker: Niels Stevens (Software Engineer Blendle)

Location and Pizza at Fourcast - Google Cloud Partner

events.name: Apache Beam workshop on Cloud Dataflow
events.description:
We know you always wanted to try and build an Apache Beam pipeline on Cloud Dataflow. But it always looks a bit intimidating with its powerful windowing semantics. This is your chance to play with Beam under the guided supervision of our Beam expert "Wout Scheepers".

Apache Beam is an open source, unified model for defining both batch and streaming data-parallel processing pipelines. Using one of the open source Beam SDKs, you build a program that defines the pipeline.

Beam is particularly useful for Embarrassingly Parallel data processing tasks, in which the problem can be decomposed into many smaller bundles of data that can be processed independently and in parallel. You can also use Beam for Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) tasks and pure data integration. These tasks are useful for moving data between different storage media and data sources, transforming data into a more desirable format, or loading data onto a new system.

Ssst... don't tell anyone, but our friends from Fourcast will raffle a

Google Home

amongst the active participants.

18:30 Doors open

19:00 Start of Code-labs

20:30 Socialising (and Google Home raffle)

Thanks to Ordina for sponsoring this event with location and food.

Route:

The bridge crossing the E19 is not accessible. Make sure to take the exit 'Rumst' and follow N1 if you are coming from Antwerp. People arriving from Brussels can either take exit 'Rumst' or 'Mechelen Noord'. Be wary of what Google Maps is telling you !

events.name: Workshop: machine learning at scale with GCP
events.description:
- What we'll do -
Google Cloud Platform has some nice tools to help you speed up and scale your machine learning projects. Last year we already had a meetup talk discussing what tools you can use for this (slides: https://bit.ly/mlwithgcp).

During this workshop we will help you actually use these tools(ML Engine & Python Dataflow) yourself. A small setup is recommended before attending the workshop. Instructions are here: https://goo.gl/qxG9Ln.

At the end of the workshop you should be able to:

* make a preprocessing pipeline (with Apache Beam) that runs on Cloud Dataflow
* locally train a model (with Tensorflow) that runs locally or on ML Engine
* deploy models on ML Engine
* use the deployed model on ML Engine as a simple API

- What to bring -
Don't forget to take your laptop with you.

events.name: User Groups New Years Reception with Google Tech Talks (via link)
events.description:

events.name: TensorFlow Dev Summit Extended Belgium (via link)
events.description:
Please register yourself here (instead of meetup):
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeuYf_CH3Ac5Ky3O2ZEcw9MGQz7gIphK81FoxWzfV9vrXp9nA/viewform?usp=sf_link

events.name: Google Cloud Onboard (via link)
events.description:
Attention: registrations are only valid using https://goo.gl/U3B3f9.

/Cloud OnBoard - Brussels is a free full-day instructor-led enablement and training event that will provide you with a step-by-step technical introduction to the Google Cloud Platform (GCP). Through a combination of instructor-led presentations and technical demonstrations, you will learn how to get started with Google App Engine, Datastore, Storage, Kubernetes Engine, Compute Engine and Network, Big Data and Machine Learning.

Cloud OnBoard has been designed for IT Managers, Systems Engineers and Operations professionals, Developers, Solution Architects and modern business leaders who are exploring cloud solutions or are new to Google Cloud Platform. Leveraging the GCP Fundamentals course, the event will provide you with the technical training you need to get started as well as access to tips and tricks, industry best-practice and questions and answers from the GCP team.

events.name: Moving to Microservice Architecture + Bonus: GCP certificate exam overview
events.description:
We'll bring you the story of how Vente-Exclusive.com moved from a big monolith to a microservices architecture. You'll get some insights and war stories, but we'll also give you a view on the architecture.

The new architecture enables rapid iterations, easy deployment and real time insights for our business analysts. We'll touch a lot of GCP technologies like Kubernetes Engine, Pub/Sub, DataFlow, BigTable, BigQuery to name but a few. It also shows you that having most of your services developed on Microsoft .NET Core isn't an issue running on the Google Cloud Platform.

Hopefully these insights will help you when you start building your next generation platform. Be sure to stick around for the ask us anything after session along with some pizza and drinks.

The story is brought by Nico Francois (Lead architect) and Alex Van Boxel (Cloud/Big Data Architect).

Bonus: Niels Buekers will give you an insight on the new Google Cloud certification with some sample questions. He will give you some pointers on how to study for the exam and talk about some of the possible pitfalls.
events.how_to_find_us: Parking instructions: on the side of the building, a fourcast colleague will help you in the parking garage between 18.30 and 18.50

events.name: Google Cloud Functions: Focus on your code, not infrastructure
events.description:
18:30 - Doors open

19:15 - GDG Cloud - Google Cloud Update
Alex Van Boxel

19:30 - Focus on your code, not infrastructure, with Google Cloud Functions
Martin Omander (https://martinomander.com/)
Google Developer Advocate (Google Mountain View)

In this talk, we will follow the story of the fictional startup "In Jest", publishers of an app that tells jokes. At first, the developers at "In Jest" need to get a minimum viable product up and running in an hour. As their business grows they will have to integrate with Google Sheets, databases, analytics systems, marketing systems and so on. We will see the 100 lines of code needed to make this happen, without having to worry the team about servers and data centers.

20:30 - Networking

events.name: BigQuery (what's new) and DataStudio
events.description:
19:00 Alex Van Boxel
BigQuery, what's new

BigQuery is constantly evolving. It's not a simple data-warehouse anymore, now you can do machine learning without leaving BigQuery. We'll give you an overview of all the new features, like ML, clustering, partitioning...

19:30
DataStudio - Overview & use case: How the Belgian Football Association is getting insights in their 400k members with Data Studio

20:00
Networking

events.name: CI/CD on Google Cloud
events.description:
Call out for all automation freaks! We'll focus on both CI and CD on Google Cloud, with both native GCP components like Pub/Sub, Cloud Build, Container Registry as open source projects like Spinnaker.

Learn how to safely and consistently deploy your workloads across several Google Cloud services like Kubernetes Engine, App Engine and Cloud Functions.

events.name: Data processing on GCP - kubernetes pipeline vs Dataflow / Apache Beam
events.description:
If you are interested in processing big amounts of data (streaming or batch), you have multiple options on GCP. During this meetups we will discuss 2 approaches & you will have the opportunity to discuss the pros/cons of multiple options afterwards.

Agenda:
* Crunching streaming data on Kubernetes - talk by Joeri De Turck (OTA Insight
* Video Analytics with Apache Beam - talk by Sven Degroote (ML6)
* Questions by the public on multiple approaches (please reach out upfront if you want us to tackle specific questions)

events.name: Moving to AI Platform
events.description:
We have two talks for you:
* Moving Deepranker from AWS and on-premise to GCP's AI Platform
* An introduction to AutoML Tables

*** AutoML Tables * Introduction by Alex Van Boxel ***
AutoML Tables enables your entire team of data scientists, analysts, and developers to automatically build and deploy state-of-the-art machine learning models on structured data at massively increased speed and scale. This short session will give you and introduction to this exciting new ML product.
--- Alex Van Boxel is a Google Developer Expert working as Lead Data Architect @ Veepee

*** Moving to AI Platform * Talk by Georges Kohnen ***
Deepranker is the deep learning recommender of Veepee, the european e-commerce leader specialised in online clearance sales. Deepranker was developed to suggest sales and brands to our tens of millions of users around Europe, thus delivering them a more personalised shopping experience.

Initiated on AWS and on-premise, feature engineering, training and serving of the recommendations were recently brought to GCP's own AI Platform. Georges Kohnen will tell us about the move, illustrating pitfalls and unexpected hurdles.
--- Georges Kohnen is a Senior Data Scientist at Veepee in Brussels, working on personalisation and recommenders in close collaboration with his peers in Paris and Barcelone..

18:30 Doors Open
19:00 Welcome
19:10 AutoML Tables - Introduction
19:25 Moving to AI Platform - Main Talk
20:15 Networking - Drinks and Pizza

events.name: Kubeflow Pipelines workshop
events.description:
Running machine learning projects in production requires a lot of orchestration. A popular way to schedule this is with Airflow, however it's not really optimized for ML workloads. The new kid on the block is Kubeflow Pipelines (part of Kubeflow). From their website: Kubeflow Pipelines is a platform for building and deploying portable, scalable machine learning (ML) workflows based on Docker containers.

We will start the workshop by providing context and an understanding of what Kubeflow Pipelines is, and when to use it. After this, there will be an intensive hands-on part in which you will create and deploy your own ML pipelines.

events.name: Bringing BigQuery data on-chain with Chainlink and LinkPool
events.description:
UPDATE - the event will be livestreamed with Q&A app for those who cannot attend. Link will be shared just before the event.

Join us at Google Brussels for an evening focused on smart contracts and Google BigQuery. We will first give short introductions to BigQuery, smart contracts and oracles. LinkPool will then give a live demonstration of a smart contract leveraging Google BigQuery’s dataset using a Chainlink Oracle.

Program:
6:00 PM: Doors open, food and drinks will be available
7:00 PM: Presentation on Google BigQuery and Big Data Warehousing (Niels Buekers, Fourcast)
7:20 PM: Presentation on smart contracts and how Chainlink oracles fit in (Johann Eid, Chainlink)
7:40 PM: Demo on smart contract deployment and httpGet jobs (Johann Eid, Chainlink)
8:00 PM: Networking & break (food and drinks will be available)
8:15 PM: Presentation on LinkPool and building the BigQuery adapter (Jonny Huxtable, LinkPool)
8:35 PM: Demo on calling a futures smart contract using Google BigQuery and a Chainlink adapter (Jonny Huxtable, LinkPool)
9:00 PM: Q&A – Questions about BigQuery, Chainlink, and LinkPool
9:30-10:00 PM: Snacks, drinks, and networking

About:

Fourcast is a Google Cloud premium partner focused on enabling people to collaborate & communicate better using Google Cloud solutions. They will be represented by Niels Buekers, co-founder and Head of Cloud Services at Fourcast.

Chainlink is the leading blockchain middleware company for smart contracts to connect to real-world data. Chainlink is building decentralized oracle technology to create externally linked smart contracts used by leading enterprises, such as SWIFT and Google, and top smart contract teams including Web3 Foundation, Zeppelin, Hadera, Celer, OpenLaw, MARKET Protocol, Kaleido, and many others. They will be represented by Johann Eid, Product Manager and Developer Evangelist at Chainlink.

LinkPool is a leading Chainlink node service provider with the goal of providing tools and services that benefit the Chainlink ecosystem. Their goal is to lower the barrier to entry to staking on Chainlink nodes, easing the amount of technical experience required to run a Chainlink node, and providing smart contract creators with the tools to easily search and identify Chainlink nodes that can suit their data requirements. They will be represented by Jonny Huxtable, Co-founder & Technical Lead at LinkPool.

events.name: Serverless
events.description:
=== Firebase, serverless application platform for mobile and web ===
During this Meetup we will present into detail the different services offered by Firebase to build an app: Authentication (User login and identity), Cloud Firestore (Realtime, cloud hosted, NoSQL database), Cloud Storage (massively scalable file storage), Cloud Functions (serverless event driven backend) and Firebase Hosting (global web hosting).

We will look at how these different services can be combined in a mix-and-match approach to implement real-life use cases. We will also detail how we can interface with other (micro-)services and APIs through Cloud Functions: for example using Google Cloud Vision API for OCR or connecting to Stripe for online payments. Finally we will look at Firebase Extensions, an exciting new feature announced recently at the Firebase Summit 2019: a set of pre-packaged bundles of code designed to automate common tasks in your projects.
--- Renaud Tarnec

=== Serverless Scraper with Cloud Run and Puppeteer ===
Cloud Run is a fully managed compute platform that automatically scales your stateless containers. Puppeteer is a Node library which provides a high-level API to control headless Chrome or Chromium over the DevTools Protocol. Combining both gives us a powerful tool to intelligently scrape websites.

--- Koen Maes

events.name: Cloud Study Jam: BigQuery for Data Warehousing (Morning session)
events.description:
Note: This Jam session is in the morning

Join a community of like-minded developers and
explore the latest Google Cloud technologies as a
team.
Join us for our upcoming Cloud Study Jam and get
hands-on experience with BigQuery for Data Warehousing

After the Study Jam, you’ll receive 30-days free
access to the entire Qwiklabs catalogue, so you can
keep developing your skills at home. Complete all of
the labs in the session’s quest, and you’ll earn an
additional free month of access to Qwiklabs as well
as a badge for your online profile.

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or
Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest
versions of popular browsers. For the best
experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or
Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

BigQuery for Data Warehousing

Looking to build or optimize your data warehouse? Learn best practices to Extract, Transform, and Load your data into Google Cloud with BigQuery. In this series of interactive labs you will create and optimize your own data warehouse using a variety of large-scale BigQuery public datasets. BigQuery is Google's fully managed, NoOps, low cost analytics database. With BigQuery you can query terabytes and terabytes of data without having any infrastructure to manage or needing a database administrator. BigQuery uses SQL and can take advantage of the pay-as-you-go model. BigQuery allows you to focus on analyzing data to find meaningful insights.

* Create a Data Warehouse Through Joins and Unions
* Creating Date-Partitioned Tables in BigQuery
* Troubleshooting and Solving Data Join Pitfalls
* Working with JSON, Arrays, and Structs in BigQuery

https://google.qwiklabs.com/quests/68?catalog_rank=%7B%22rank%22%3A4%2C%22num_filters%22%3A1%2C%22has_search%22%3Atrue%7D&search_id=2794878

events.name: Security on GCP
events.description:
Working on GCP (or any other cloud provider), means that you can rely on managed infrastructure or services that already take care of some security aspects. However, it remains a shared responsibility!

During this evening, we (Robin De Neef & Rob Vandenberghe) want to shine some light on the multiple aspects of having a secure application and go a bit deeper into 2 projects/products that can help with that:
- Forseti
- Cloud Security Command Center

upcoming.name: Virtual Class GCP Fundamentals : Big Data & Machine Learning
upcoming.description:
In collaboration with Google, we are organizing the course "Google Cloud Platform Fundamentals: Big Data & Machine Learning".

This course will be happening over 2 days, 4 hours per day 1PM-5PM

This instructor-led course introduces participants to the big data capabilities of Google Cloud Platform. Through a combination of presentations, demos, and hands-on labs, participants get an overview of the Google Cloud platform and a detailed view of the data processing and machine learning capabilities. This course showcases the ease, flexibility, and power of big data solutions on Google Cloud Platform.

The course focuses on 4 cool use cases that we will solve during the hands-on labs :

- Recommendation engine for a real estate website using SparkML
- Prediction of visitor purchases using BigQuery ML
- Visualize realtime taxi rides using Pubsub, Cloud Dataflow and Datastudio
- Classify different types of clouds for flight plans using AutoML Vision

To participate, signup via the Google event page : https://events.withgoogle.com/machinelearn-437628-virtual/

Google manages to subscriptions and will send out a calendar invite with the hangouts link to join the training.

upcoming.name: Learn from a Kaggle Grandmaster - NLP demo using Kubeflow on GCP
upcoming.description:
Dear Kaggle, Machine Learning and Google Cloud Platform lovers,

We are glad to announce a "hands on" data science meetup on March 26. We will have the pleasure of having a Kaggle Grandmaster (Arthur Tok) leading the first part of the meetup.

He will start by going through one of the competitions he almost won before stating the difference between Kaggle data science and real life data science. He will do so by talking about his current position as Machine Learning Engineer at Barclays in London.

Second part of the meetup will focus on a real NLP machine learning use case using state-of-the-art models running on Google Cloud Platform with Kubeflow in the backend.

The meetup will then finish with a networking session around some bites and drinks.

group_profile.intro: Yet another human agent processing unstructured data

organizers.name: Alex Van B.
organizers.bio: Alex is a Big Data and Cloud Architect. He loves working on operational requirement and starting new initiatives, has a engineering & testing backgrnd. Loves talking about technology and sharing his knowledge through mentoring, articles and speaking.

group_profile.intro: I'm an uber-geek, loving technology. I'm also a GDE (Google Developer Expert 'Cloud').
Data Geek. Passionate about gaining insights from data! Google Developer Expert for ML and Cloud
